1.m: NFTs or non-fungible tokens refer to unique assets, which are stored on blockchain and maintain unique ownership. @.md:faq.a.1.l1
1.l1: [You can find more about Non-Fungible Token at Wikipedia](@.common:links.wikipedia.nft)

2.m: Minting is a process in which your cryptocurrency wallet and blockchain communicate together and make you able to create NFTs.

3.m: In the left upper corner, you click on @.md:faq.a.3.l1 and choose Simple or Classic mint.

4.m:
You can mint practically anything, actual possibilites:
@.md:faq.a.4.l1

5.m: At the time of writing, the fee for minting a NFT are 0.02 USD.

6.m: First of all, you need to install @.md:faq.a.6.l1, backup your seed. Then you can top up your wallet address @.md:faq.a.6.l2 or use our @.md:faq.a.6.l3 feature. Once you have funds, head to @.md:faq.a.6.l4, choose Collection. Wait till Collection is minted, then you go to @.md:faq.a.6.l5 and Mint your very first token! Feel free to share it with us on our @.md:faq.a.6.l6

7.m: Right now, there's plenty of @.md:faq.a.7.l1 which support KSM trading. The safest are probably @.md:faq.a.7.l2 and @.md:faq.a.7.l3 or try decentralized @.md:faq.a.7.l4

8.m: We recommend to obtain KSM through custodial exchanges like @.md:faq.a.8.l1 and @.md:faq.a.8.l2 or you can use our RAMP network integration - a fiat ramp @.md:faq.a.8.l3 If you are struggling with this, feel free to ask for a @.md:faq.a.8.l4 or let us know in @.md:faq.a.8.l5 channel on discord.

9.m: We are exploring possibilities, we actually plan to actively research on this in our milestone 2.

10.m: For best rates, you can @.md:faq.a.10.l1 For best experience @.md:faq.a.10.l2 If you are @.md:faq.a.10.l3

11.m: We are trying to deliver incremental updates on daily basis & fixes ASAP. We may have published new version and your browser has cached old one. If you are on Windows, try hold down Ctrl and then press F5. Mac users, hold down CMD and Shift and then press R. If this did not help, DM us on Twitter or discord with screenshot where is developer console open.

12.m: SEND will send it to someone, CONSUME will burn it, LIST will list it for sale so someone can buy it from you.

13.m: Best way is to check through @.md:faq.a.13.l1 and lookup your address. @.md:faq.a.13.l2
13.l2: [You can find example how minted NFT looks through explorer, when you look on extrinsics.](@.common:links.kusama_scanner.extrinsic.href)

14.m: Yes, if for example it's problematic for you to withdraw from an exchange or use fiat-onramp, you may visit our discord and ask for small amount of KSM in @.md:faq.a.14.l1 channel on our discord or ask for @.md:faq.a.14.l2 to cover minting costs.

15.m: If you haven't set the price of your NFT at the beginning, navigate to your @.md:faq.a.15.l1, choose your NFT in Created and click on LIST, which will make you able to set the price.

16.m: Right now, we don't have chain logic, but we plan to implement something great, soon. @.md:faq.a.16.l1

17.m: We believe that costs for actions at Ethereum may be high in future and its current PoW is not environmentally friendly. We believe in network effects of Kusama/Polkadot effects from other parachains. A more detailed answer can be found @.md:faq.a.17.l1

18.m: CLASSIC let's you create collection and add NFTs to it. SIMPLE mint will create NFT collectible and add it to your profile and PERMAFROST is NFT minting using Arweave protocol: The protocol matches people who have hard drive space to spare with those individuals and organizations that need to store data or host content permanently.

19.m: Right now, we have @.md:faq.a.19.l1 We are actively looking for funding options, eventually we would raise private funds. DMs us, if you are interested into private sale.

20.m: We only have a private channel for NFT creators. Feel free to DM us if you are a NFT creator!

21.m: Yes, that's part of our Milestone 2, stay tuned!

22.m: If you are on Mac, on Chrome hit Option, CMD, J, Firefox Command + Option + K.

23.m: Go to @.md:faq.a.23.l1 and click the button Update metadata, then refresh your window. It should be working with recent chain types.

24.m: Check if you have transferable $KSM on your account, not staked. That's different. You can check it at @.md:faq.a.24.l1 and at balances unfold, where the Transferable amount will be displayed.

26.m: No, there is no official token launched. Please follow official social media and be aware of scam and phissing attempts from unofficial sources. DYOR.

27.m: We are always welcoming contributions from our community. There are numerous @.md:faq.a.27.l1 for all skill levels - some will even be rewarded in $KSM. @.md:faq.a.27.l2

28.m: No, this possibility is not here at this moment. If you would like to propose a change, feel free to create an @.md:faq.a.28.l1 on our GitHub.

29.m: You can access latest KodaDot presskit @.md:faq.a.29.l1

30.m: Kodadot is an NFT Platform that is community-driven, running on a low carbon footprint blockchain. Kusama is a pre-production environment for the Polkadot network. $KSM is the coin used for interacting the Kusama network. Since it's a sandbox for early projects which like to move fast and break things on the Polkadot ecosystem, expect Chaos.

31.m: All minted files will observe the Code of Conduct and all NSFW (Not Safe For Work) files should be classified NSFW when minting.

32.m: On the Polkadot network, an address is only active when it holds a minimum amount, currently set at 1 DOT (and 0.0000333333 KSM on the Kusama network). This minimum amount is called the Existential Deposit (ED). @.md:faq.a.32.l1

33.m:
Royalties, or royalty payments, are financial payments that are made from one party to another for the ongoing use of their assets. The term is most commonly associated with the music industry, where musicians allow their records to be played on the radio, streamed online, or sampled by other musicians in exchange for a (royalty) fee. However, it isn't just musicians that are owed royalties when their work is used. Songwriters, composers, publishers, novelists, producers, and just about anybody involved in a creative process has the potential to claim royalties.

NFT royalties give artists a percentage of the sale price each time their artwork is resold. No matter how many secondary sales occur, the royalties will always be paid back to the original creator, and the best part is that the whole process is automated.

34.m: Transaction fees prevent individual users from consuming too many resources. Polkadot uses a weight-based fee model as opposed to a gas-metering model. As such, fees are charged prior to transaction execution; once the fee is paid, nodes will execute the transaction.

35.m: Currently, the minimum cost of transferring KSM is 0.01 KSM (the base fee), although this can be changed via governance.

36.m: RMRK is currently just an NFT baked into the blockchain and we don't have any chain logic. From the lesson of randomness, we know that there is the possibility that two or more people can make buy transactions in the same block and can lose money. Then it's just about the honesty of the artist to return the money or mint the same NFT as the token of appreciation.

37.m: Yes, currently the KodaDot integration in Nova wallet is working fine. We've made @.md:faq.a.37.l1 on how to do this.

1.heading: Did you know...
1.question: that back in 2015 we launched the first official NFT called Etheria?

2.heading: Did you know...
2.question: that the first 'NFT-like' standard on Kusama is literally just byte strings?

3.heading: Did you know...
3.question: that KodaDot has started as a rewrite of React-based DotApps dashboard into Vuejs?

4.heading: Did you know...
4.question: that KodaDot is building an experimental NFT landscape?

5.heading: Did you know...
5.question: that there is so much psychadelic and trippy NFT artwork? We do not know either.

6.heading: Can you guess...
6.question: how many parachains KodaDot does support? Get the exact answer on our Discord!

7.heading: Can you guess...
7.question: how many GitHub forks the KodaDot repository has?

8.heading: Can you guess...
8.question: how many GitHub stars the KodaDot repository has?

9.heading: Do you think ...
9.question: KodaDot should launch its own $koda token?

10.heading: Can you guess...
10.question: how many NFTs KodaDot is indexing from all parachains?

11.heading: Did you know...
11.question: that KodaDot has an mobile app?

12.heading: Did you know...
12.question: that KodaDot was among the first NFT galleries supporting augmented reality for 3D objects, back in early January 2021?

13.heading: Did you know...
13.question: that KodaDot had fuckups during its early days? Yeah, all startups go through failures to learn from mistakes. That's how we knew that our product is getting better.

14.heading: Did you know...
14.question: that KodaDot has its core values and ethos being distributed, decentralized and community-owned? Try participating in our ever-growing community!

15.heading: Did you know...
15.question: that KodaDot has replaced three of its logos in one month?

16.heading: Did you know...
16.question: that KodaDot's community translations was greatest growth hack for building community to participate?

17.heading: Did you know...
17.question: that KodaDot had 420 Discord members on their investors pitch deck? What a coincidence.

18.heading: Did you know...
18.question: that KodaDot's founders encourage forking it's codebase and welcome more KodaDot instances in the wild?

19.heading: Did you know...
19.question: that one of KodaDot's founders was running an infrastructure for eSports back in 2006?

20.heading: Did you know...
20.question: that these facts don't even matter? We just love to spend time with you till your action is finalized into Blockchain.

21.heading: Don't forget to...
21.question: drink enough water to stay hydrated!

22.heading: Did you know...
22.question: that we've more than 500 opened issues in our backlog on GitHub?

23.heading: Did you know...
23.question: that KodaDot promotes an inclusive culture to be welcoming for a wide spectrum of artists that contribute to its growth?

24.heading: Did you know...
24.question: that if you make a pull request on KodaDot's repository, your fun fact can be shown here?

27.heading: Did you know...
27.question: that the first version of KodaDot looked worse than Craiglist in 1999?

28.heading: Did you know...
28.question: that KodaDot's founders won a few Ethereum and Polkadot hackathons in the past?

29.heading: Did you know...
29.question: that KodaDot had to lay off few dozens investors interested in backing us?

30.heading: Did you know...
30.question: that KodaDot cares about Climate change by planting trees in Portugal, called KodaForest?

31.heading: Did you know...
31.question: that the founders of KodaDot believe in simulated reality?

33.heading: Did you know...
33.question: that people from all over the world contribute to our codebase?

34.heading: Did you know...
34.question: KodaDot has offset 10,000 kilograms of CO2, which is equivalent to 2,500 cheeseburgers.

35.heading: Did you know...
35.question: that you can get an overview of all available shortcuts by pressing '?'

all.title: Mass mint all
all.description: You can specify the range of the mass mint, it will create NFTs with the same symbol and name, but different amount. It will also create different amount of NFTs with the same symbol and name, but different amount.
